            Bio
            I am a computational social scientist doing research at the poltextLAB within Centre for Social Sciences, Budapest. I am also providing text analysis and data analysis consultancy to the International Monetary Fund’s Independent Evaluation Office. My main research interest is the application of quantitative text analysis and other big data methods in the political economy field.
            I employ a wide variety of methods in my research, particularly automated text analysis (and attached various machine learning approaches), network analysis and more traditional econometric techniques. I also happen to teach some of these in R as well. Most of my courses and workshops are open sourced and can be accessed via my GitHub page.
            
            
            
            Current Positions
            2020 - Present | Consultant | International Monetary Fund, Washington DC.
            2019 - Present | Research Fellow | PoltextLAB, Centre for Social Sciences, Budapest
            
            
            
            Education
            2015 - 2019 | PhD, Political Science | Central European University, Budapest
            2018             | Visiting PhD Researcher | KU Leuven, Leuven
            2016 - 2017 | Advanced Certificate, Network Science | Central European University, Budapest
            2014 - 2015 | MA, International Political Economy | Central European University, Budapest
